author: Daemon Capital
title: Viff.Club: Slimey Emotional NFTs
description: NFTs are just random and dull files. But, what if NFTs could be slimes? Be alive, independent, autonomous, emotional, and have live goals?

assessments.note: Even though I personally find the demo duller than some NFTs the proposer is bashing, I see potential if implemented right. While it's a stretch to call this a game, it may help in adoption and set a bar for true games on Cardano in the future.
Could be an interesting DApp if it goes viral

Valid application that addresses the challenge and certainly sure to generate plenty  of interest. The proposal seems a little chaotic at present and it may need further refinement and attention to priority to progress further.
Emotionally reactive NFTs have a niche market and can become a source of innovation. The proposal also has constructs that can cater to the gaming NFT market with slight adaptation.

This project is somewhat similar to an Ethereum-based game, called "Axie Infinity" that seems to be popular at the moment and has a big base of players. This project seems to be going in a similar direction, though their NFTs will not have as many playable functions. If it proves successful, it could lead to a growing community of players and of Cardano developers.

Traditional web development has little overlap when it comes to blockchain development. The plan only addresses the UI. The proposers' listed strengths vary tremendously among their multiple ideas. I deem the anonymous nature troubling in combination with a high ask. The scarce GitLab history gives further reason to not have confidence in a successful implementation.

Where does React gets its data from? What will the mentioned server look like? How does it transact wit the Cardano blockchain?
More details on how the proposer intend to market this project once built to get it to go viral would be good.

Difficult to assess higher due to anonymity wish of proposers which I understand but then cannot really assess experience. I do feel its highly likely that they may have excellent experience but then how would I know? The plan while detailed is somewhat chaotic and while this speaks of great enthusiasm I would like to see a more measured approach that promises to deliver an achievable proposal.

The proposal is made by anonymous proposers. The innovative idea is good however there is limited information to verify the capability and experience. The viff.club sire referenced in the proposal is not sufficient for judging the capability of the team.

As one of the comments on the proposal has also brought to the attention, the team refuses to provide identity and credentials, stating that "pseudonymity and concentration on the proof of work and delivery builds much stronger trust than just showing faces and credentials". This statement might be valid in some contexts, however in the case of Project Catalyst, the team's experience is a requirement, based on the fact that everything is open, community-based and can provide some form of trust that the team is capable of finishing the project.
In combination with open source repositories, the progress could be compared with the outlined timeline. Self-specified success can be audited with the deployed DApp.
A social media marketing plan would be a good addition. This would only work if it can go viral.

I actually feel this proposal has great potential and hope the proposers consider a stepped application that starts the process without asking the PC community to trust us we know what we are doing. Lots of potential and I highly recommend building relationships within the PC community and aligned enterprises (such as singularityNet).

The proposal is comprehensive and is addressing all the technical components of the project. The success of the project is very difficult to predict. However, based on the current NFT trend and market there is a very good chance the project is successful.

The budget is not detailed and they recognise that they only have approximate numbers based on their experience, but since they refuse to reveal their experience, then the approximations cannot have a valuable meaning. These two areas, team experience and budget, are very important in assessing a project. I suggest the team tries to find a way in which they can present themselves to dissipate any kind of worry, in the process making their budget look well grounded and re-submit their proposal to a future fund.

solution: Viff - your crypto-friend. One and only. Stored on-chain with emotions, gadgets, goals, and look metadata. Simulated in an off-chain world.
experience: Founders experienced in game and blockchain development, vector graphics, world design, AI&ML, and relevant work and education experience.
